comment.text: This translation key is used for the label on a button or option that allows users to pin items to the top of their list. It appears in various contexts, including settings or options dialogs, where users can customize their interaction with pinned content. The text should be translated from "Pin to top" to make it consistent across different languages.

usage.context:
const pinOptions = [
 {
 id: "option_pin-room",
 key: "pin-room",
 label: t("PinToTop"),
 icon: PinReactSvgUrl,
 onClick: (e) => this.onClickPin(e, item.id, t),
 disabled:
 this.publicRoomStore.isPublicRoom ||
 Boolean(item.external && item.expired),

const pinOptions = [
 {
 id: "option_pin-room",
 key: "pin-room",
 label: t("PinToTop"),
 icon: PinReactSvgUrl,
 onClick: (e) => this.onClickPin(e, item.id, t),
 disabled:
 this.publicRoomStore.isPublicRoom ||
 Boolean(item.external && item.expired),

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'تثبيت في أعلى الصفحة' is a literal translation of 'Pin to top', it doesn't convey the same functionality or user understanding in a UI context. Users expect a more intuitive term.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'إبقاء في الأعلى' (Ibaqa fi al-a'la) or 'تثبيت في القمة' (Tathbeet fi al-qimma) which better reflect the pinning functionality.  Research common UI terminology in Saudi Arabic for 'Pin to top' to find the most appropriate translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Yuxarıya sabitləyin" is a literal translation of "Pin to top", it might not be the most natural or idiomatic phrasing in Azerbaijani. "Pin to top" often implies fixing something at the top of a list or interface. A more suitable translation might focus on that function.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Yuxarıya keçir" (Move to top) or "Yuxarıya bərkidərin" (Fix to top), or even exploring more context-dependent phrasing depending on the UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Закачете най-отгоре" is understandable, it's not the most natural or idiomatic translation of "Pin to top". It literally translates to "Attach to the top".  A better translation would capture the functionality of pinning an item to the top of a list or display.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Закрепи към горната част" or "Фиксирай най-отгоре" for a more accurate representation of the action.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Oben anstecken" is technically correct, it's not the most natural or common way to translate "Pin to top" in a UI context. It sounds quite literal and doesn't convey the meaning of fixing something to the top of a list or view.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be something like "An den oberen Rand anheften", "Fest an den oberen Rand setzen", or "Nach oben fixieren". The best choice will depend on the exact UI element and desired tone.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Καρφίτσωμα στην κορυφή" is a literal translation, it's not the most natural or commonly used phrasing in Greek for "Pin to top." It sounds somewhat awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be something like "Στάχυση" or "Κλείδωμα στην κορυφή". "Στάχυση" is a very common translation for 'pinning' in digital interfaces.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Anclar al principio' is technically 'Anchor to the beginning', the common and idiomatic Spanish translation for 'Pin to top' in a UI context (like a list or board) is 'Fijar en la parte superior' or 'Fijar arriba'. 'Anclar al principio' implies attaching something to the very start, not necessarily pinning it to the top.

While 'Kiinnitä yläreunaan' is understandable, it's a quite literal translation and not the most natural way to express 'Pin to top' in Finnish. A more idiomatic translation would better reflect the intended meaning in a UI context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Lukitse yläosaan' or 'Kiinnitä otsikkoon', depending on the specific UI element being referred to. 'Kiinnitä näkyviin' could also be appropriate.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation "Ամրացնել վերին մասում" literally translates to "Secure/Fasten in the top part". While conveying a similar concept, it's not the most natural or idiomatic translation of "Pin to top". A more suitable translation would capture the action of pinning something to the top of a list or display.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Թողնել ամենամեծի վրա" or "Լքել գագաթին" which better convey the action of pinning to the top.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "ປັກໝຸດຢູ່ເທິງ" translates literally to "Pin at top", the standard and more natural translation of "Pin to top" in a user interface context in Lao would be "ຫມຸດເທິງສຸດ" or "ຍຶດໝຸດເທິງສຸດ". "ປັກໝຸດຢູ່ເທິງ" sounds awkward and doesn't accurately convey the intended meaning of pinning something to the very top of a list or collection.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຫມຸດເທິງສຸດ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Przypnij u góry" literally translates to 'Pin at the top'. While understandable, a more natural and idiomatic translation for 'Pin to top' in a UI context would be something like "Przypnij na górę" or "Przypiąć na górę". "Przypnij u góry" can imply pinning *within* the top area, rather than pinning *to* the top.

The translation "Afixar em cima" doesn't perfectly capture the meaning of "Pin to top." While "Afixar" means to attach or fix, "em cima" (on top) is not the best way to convey the action of pinning something to the top of a list or interface. It could be misinterpreted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Fixar no topo" or "Anclar ao topo" which more accurately reflect the intended functionality.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Fixare sus' is a literal translation of 'Pin to top', it doesn't convey the intended meaning of pinning something to the top of a list or interface. A more natural Romanian equivalent would convey the idea of permanence or sticking to the top.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Ține sus', 'Fixat sus', 'Blocare sus', or 'Afixare sus'. The best option depends on the specific context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "මුදුනට අමුණන්න" while literally meaning "attach to the top", doesn't convey the intended meaning of 'Pin to top' which implies fixing an item at the top of a list or view.  It's too literal and lacks the nuance of a pinning action.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation would be something along the lines of "ප්‍රමුඛ ස්ථානයට තැබන්න" (pramukha sthanaya thabanna) which means 'place at the top' or "ඉහළට යවන්න" (ihala yavana) which means 'send to the top'.  A more idiomatic expression would be preferable.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Pripnúť hore' is technically a literal translation of 'Pin to top', it doesn't convey the intended meaning of pinning something to the top of a list or view. It sounds awkward and unnatural in Slovak in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation would be 'Upevniť na vrch' or 'Zafixovať na vrch' or 'Prichytiť na vrch'.  Alternatively, depending on the user interface, 'Umiestniť na vrchol' could work.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation "Закачи на врх" while understandable, isn't the most natural or precise translation of "Pin to top". It literally translates to "Attach to top". A more idiomatic translation would convey the action of pinning something so it remains at the top.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Прикачи на врх" or "Залепи на врх" which more accurately capture the 'pinning' action, though finding a perfect equivalent is challenging.
